cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.entities

Class VirtualMachine.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.entities.VirtualMachine.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    VirtualMachine

    public static class VirtualMachine.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that represents a key part of so called Builder pattern. Static class Builder is used only for more transparent, easier and faster set up of VirtualMachine attributes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Builder(java.util.UUID id, java.lang.String vmName, PhysicalMachine hostMachine)
      The first and the only construcotr of the static class Builder used for setting up the key (mandatory) values of the virtual machine.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      VirtualMachine build()
      Creates a new virtual machine with the set up attributes.

      Sets the number of virtual CPUs which will be used for virtual machine initialization.

      Sets the number of monitors which will be used for virtual machine initialization.

      Sets the virtual CPU execution limitation which will by used for the virtual machine initialization.

      Sets the free space size of the virtual hard disk which will be used for the virtual machine initialization.

      Sets the total space size of the virtual hard disk which will be used for the virtual machine initialization.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Builder

        public Builder(java.util.UUID id,
               java.lang.String vmName,
               PhysicalMachine hostMachine)
        The first and the only construcotr of the static class Builder used for setting up the key (mandatory) values of the virtual machine. There can be thrown the following exceptions:
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when there occurs one of the following problems:
          1. given uuid of virtual machine is null or empty
          2. given name of virtual machine is null or empty
          3. given host machine of virtual machine is null
        Parameters:
        id - uuid which will be used for virtual machine which is going to be initialized
        vmName - name which will be used for virtual machine which is going to be initialized
        hostMachine - physical machine on which virtual machine which is going to be initialized is present

    • Method Detail

      • countOfCPU

        public VirtualMachine.Builder countOfCPU(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the number of virtual CPUs which will be used for virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - number of virtual CPUs which virtual machine uses
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • countOfMonitors

        public VirtualMachine.Builder countOfMonitors(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the number of monitors which will be used for virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - number of monitors which virtual machine uses
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • cpuExecutionCap

        public VirtualMachine.Builder cpuExecutionCap(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the virtual CPU execution limitation which will by used for the virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - CPU execution limitation expressed in percents
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • hardDiskFreeSpaceSize

        public VirtualMachine.Builder hardDiskFreeSpaceSize(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the free space size of the virtual hard disk which will be used for the virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - hard disk free space size in bytes
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • hardDiskTotalSize

        public VirtualMachine.Builder hardDiskTotalSize(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the total space size of the virtual hard disk which will be used for the virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - hard disk total size in bytes
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • sizeOfRAM

        public VirtualMachine.Builder sizeOfRAM(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the amount of memory allocated for virtual machine which will be used for the virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - size of allocated memory in megabytes
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • sizeOfVRAM

        public VirtualMachine.Builder sizeOfVRAM(java.lang.Long value)
        Sets the size of video memory which will be used for the virtual machine initialization. If the the given value is negative then the value is set up to zero.
        Parameters:
        value - size of video memory in megabytes, used
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • typeOfOS

        public VirtualMachine.Builder typeOfOS(java.lang.String value)
        Sets the type of virtual machine OS which will be used for virtual machine initialization. If the given value is null or empty then the string value is set up to "Unknown".
        Parameters:
        value - type of virtual machine OS
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • identifierOfOS

        public VirtualMachine.Builder identifierOfOS(java.lang.String value)
        Sets the identifier of virtual machine OS which will be used for virtual machine initialization. If the given value is null or empty then the string value is set up to "Unknown".
        Parameters:
        value - identifier of virtual machine OS
        Returns:
        instance of actual Builder class for more compact and dynamic building class

      • build

        public VirtualMachine build()
        Creates a new virtual machine with the set up attributes.
        Returns:
